articles.title: Phrases de r√©confort en polonais : Soutenir son partenaire
articles.content:
## Soutenir son partenaire en polonais

Les Polonais sont chaleureux et solidaires. Voici comment r√©conforter.

## Phrases de r√©confort

### "Jestem tu dla ciebie"
**Prononciation :** YES-t√©m tou dla TCH√â-by√©

**Signification :** Je suis l√† pour toi

### "Wszystko bƒôdzie dobrze"
**Prononciation :** VCHIST-ko B√âN-dj√© DOB-j√©

**Signification :** Tout ira bien

### "Nie jeste≈õ w tym sam/sama"
**Prononciation :** ny√© YES-t√©ch v tim SAM/SA-ma

**Signification :** Tu n'es pas seul(e)

## √âcouter et valider

### "Rozumiem, jak siƒô czujesz"
**Prononciation :** ro-ZOU-mi√©m yak ch√© TCHOU-y√©ch

**Signification :** Je comprends ce que tu ressens

### "To normalne tak siƒô czuƒá"
**Prononciation :** to nor-MAL-n√© tak ch√© TCHOUITCH

**Signification :** C'est normal de ressentir √ßa

## Soutien actif

### "Co mogƒô zrobiƒá, ≈ºeby ci pom√≥c?"
**Prononciation :** tso MO-gu√© ZRO-bitch J√â-bi tchi PO-mouts

**Signification :** Que puis-je faire pour t'aider ?

### "Zawsze jestem tu, ≈ºeby ciƒô wys≈Çuchaƒá"
**Prononciation :** ZAV-ch√© YES-t√©m tou J√â-bi tch√© vi-SWOU-khatch

**Signification :** Je suis toujours l√† pour t'√©couter

## Encouragement

### "Jeste≈õ silniejszy/silniejsza ni≈º my≈õlisz"
**Prononciation :** YES-t√©ch shil-NY√â√è-chi / shil-NY√â√è-cha nij MI-chlich

**Signification :** Tu es plus fort(e) que tu ne le penses

### "Wierzƒô w ciebie"
**Prononciation :** VY√â-j√© v TCH√â-by√©

**Signification :** Je crois en toi

### "Dasz radƒô"
**Prononciation :** dach RA-d√©

**Signification :** Tu vas y arriver

## Moments difficiles

### "Tak mi przykro, ≈ºe przez to przechodzisz"
**Prononciation :** tak mi PCHI-kro j√© pch√©z to pch√©-KHO-djich

**Signification :** Je suis d√©sol√©(e) que tu traverses √ßa

### "Pozw√≥l, ≈ºe ciƒô przytulƒô"
**Prononciation :** POZ-voul j√© tch√© pchi-TOU-l√©

**Signification :** Laisse-moi te serrer dans mes bras

### "Przejdziemy przez to razem"
**Prononciation :** pch√©√Ø-DJI√â-mi pch√©z to RA-z√©m

**Signification :** On va surmonter √ßa ensemble

## Conclusion

Le soutien en polonais est chaleureux et solidaire. Montrez votre pr√©sence et votre amour.

articles.title: German Baby & Pregnancy Vocabulary: Essential Words for Expecting Couples
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Expecting a Baby with your German-speaking partner is an exciting journey. Learning the essential Baby and pregnancy vocabulary in German will help you participate fully in doctor visits, shopping for the Kinderzimmer, and those precious first conversations with your little one.

For everyday communication with your partner, check out our guide on [essential German phrases for couples](/blog/en/essential-german-phrases-for-couples).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Baby"
  translation="baby"
  pronunciation="Baby"
  context="The most important word for your growing family."
/>

## Essential Pregnancy Vocabulary

<VocabCard
  word="schwanger"
  translation="pregnant"
  pronunciation="schwanger"
  example="We're erwartet ein Baby!"
/>

| German | English | Context |
|---|---|---|
| Baby | baby | Your little one |
| schwanger | pregnant | The condition |
| erwartet ein Baby | expecting | Anticipating baby |
| Geburtstermin | due date | When baby arrives |
| Ultraschall | ultrasound | Seeing baby |
| Kinderzimmer | nursery | Baby's room |
| Windel | diaper | Essential item |
| Flasche | bottle | For feeding |
| Kinderwagen | stroller | For walks |
| Krippe | crib | Baby's bed |

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá™" title="German Pregnancy Traditions">
In German-speaking cultures, pregnancy is often celebrated with specific traditions. Baby showers, gender reveals, and family gatherings are common ways to welcome the new arrival. It's traditional to wait until after birth to buy certain items.
</CultureTip>

## Announcing the News

### To Your Partner's Family
- **We're erwartet ein Baby a Baby!** - The big announcement
- **You're going to be grandparents!** - For the parents
- **We have wonderful news!** - Building anticipation

### To Friends
- **We're having a Baby!** - Direct and joyful
- **Our family is growing!** - Gentle announcement
- **Little one on the way!** - Cute phrasing

<VocabCard
  word="erwartet ein Baby"
  translation="expecting"
  pronunciation="erwartet ein Baby"
  example="We are erwartet ein Baby in spring!"
/>

## At the Doctor's Office

Essential phrases for prenatal appointments:

| German | English | When to Use |
|---|---|---|
| Geburtstermin | due date | Asking about timeline |
| Ultraschall | ultrasound | For the scan |
| schwanger | pregnant | Medical discussions |
| Healthy Baby | healthy baby | Good news |
| erwartet ein Baby | expecting | General context |

### Questions to Ask
- **When is the Geburtstermin?** - Timeline question
- **Is the Baby healthy?** - Health check
- **When is the next Ultraschall?** - Appointment planning

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá™" title="Medical Appointments">
In German-speaking healthcare settings, prenatal care may follow specific schedules. Having your partner help translate during appointments is invaluable, or bring a translation app as backup.
</CultureTip>

## Nursery and Baby Items

### Setting Up the Kinderzimmer

| German | English | Description |
|---|---|---|
| Krippe | crib | Baby's sleeping place |
| Kinderwagen | stroller | For transportation |
| Windel | diaper | Essential supplies |
| Flasche | bottle | Feeding equipment |
| Kinderzimmer | nursery | Baby's room |

### Shopping Vocabulary
- **We need Windels** - Basic necessity
- **Where are the Flasches?** - Store navigation
- **This Krippe is perfect!** - Making choices
- **The Kinderwagen fits well** - Practical decisions

<VocabCard
  word="Kinderzimmer"
  translation="nursery / baby's room"
  pronunciation="Kinderzimmer"
  example="We're decorating the Kinderzimmer."
/>

## Talking to Your Baby

Sweet phrases for your little one:

| German Phrase | English | Moment |
|---|---|---|
| Hello, little Baby | Hello, little baby | First greeting |
| I love you, Baby | I love you, baby | Any moment |
| Sleep well, little one | Sleep well | Bedtime |
| Beautiful Baby | Beautiful baby | Admiration |

## Baby Shower Vocabulary

| German | English | Context |
|---|---|---|
| Baby shower | baby shower | The celebration |
| Gift for Baby | baby gift | Presents |
| Congratulations | congratulations | Well-wishes |
| The Kinderzimmer | the nursery | Showing preparations |

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá™" title="Baby Naming">
In German-speaking cultures, baby names often carry family significance or honor loved ones. Discuss naming traditions with your partner early, as choosing a name that works in both languages can be important.
</CultureTip>

## After the Baby Arrives

First moments vocabulary:

### At the Hospital
- **The Baby is here!** - Announcement
- **Healthy Baby!** - Good news
- **Beautiful Baby!** - First reactions

### First Days Home
- **Time to change the Windel** - Daily care
- **The Baby is hungry** - Feeding time
- **Baby is sleeping** - Quiet time

For more family vocabulary, explore our [meeting your German partner's family](/blog/en/meeting-your-german-partners-family) guide.

## Quick Reference Card

| Need | Vocabulary |
|---|---|
| Announcement | We're erwartet ein Baby! |
| Doctor visit | Geburtstermin, Ultraschall |
| Shopping | Krippe, Windel, Flasche |
| Daily care | Baby, Windel, Flasche |

Your journey into parenthood in two languages will give your Baby the beautiful gift of bilingualism. Every word you learn in German strengthens your family bond.

<CTA />

articles.title: 40+ Frasi Romantiche Inglesi per Ogni Momento
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

L'inglese √® una lingua ricca di espressioni romantiche che possono aiutarti a conquistare e mantenere vivo l'amore con il tuo partner. Che tu stia iniziando una nuova relazione o voglia ravvivare quella esistente, queste frasi ti aiuteranno a esprimere i tuoi sentimenti pi√π profondi.

In questa guida completa, esploreremo le frasi romantiche pi√π belle e utili in inglese, organizzate per situazione e con la pronuncia corretta per aiutarti a padroneggiarle.

## Frasi per Iniziare la Giornata

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Good morning, beautiful"
  translation="Buongiorno, bella"
  pronunciation="gud morning, biutiful"
  context="Perfetto per svegliare il tuo partner con dolcezza."
/>

Iniziare la giornata con parole dolci √® un modo meraviglioso per mostrare affetto:

<VocabCard
  word="Good morning, sunshine"
  translation="Buongiorno, raggio di sole"
  pronunciation="gud morning, sansciain"
  example="Good morning, sunshine! Ready for a beautiful day?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I dreamed about you last night"
  translation="Ho sognato di te stanotte"
  pronunciation="ai drimd abaut yu last nait"
  example="I dreamed about you last night and woke up smiling."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Waking up next to you is the best part of my day"
  translation="Svegliarmi accanto a te √® la parte migliore della mia giornata"
  pronunciation="weikign ap nekst tu yu iz dhe best part ov mai dei"
  example="Every morning I think: waking up next to you is the best part of my day."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="You're the first thing I think about"
  translation="Sei la prima cosa a cui penso"
  pronunciation="yur dhe first thing ai think abaut"
  example="You're the first thing I think about when I wake up."
/>

## Espressioni di Affetto Quotidiano

<VocabCard
  word="I miss you"
  translation="Mi manchi"
  pronunciation="ai mis yu"
  example="I miss you so much when we're apart."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I can't stop thinking about you"
  translation="Non riesco a smettere di pensare a te"
  pronunciation="ai kant stop thinkign abaut yu"
  example="I can't stop thinking about you all day."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="You make me so happy"
  translation="Mi rendi cos√¨ felice"
  pronunciation="yu meik mi sou hapi"
  example="You make me so happy, I can't believe my luck."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I'm so lucky to have you"
  translation="Sono cos√¨ fortunato/a ad averti"
  pronunciation="aim sou laki tu hav yu"
  example="I'm so lucky to have you in my life."
/>

<CultureTip title="Nota Culturale" flag="üá¨üáß">
Nei paesi anglofoni, esprimere affetto verbalmente √® molto comune e apprezzato. Non essere timido/a nel dire queste frasi - il tuo partner le apprezzer√†, specialmente se sei italiano/a e stai imparando la sua lingua!
</CultureTip>

## Complimenti Romantici

Fare complimenti √® un'arte. Ecco alcune frasi per far sentire speciale il tuo partner:

<VocabCard
  word="You look absolutely stunning"
  translation="Sei assolutamente stupendo/a"
  pronunciation="yu luk absolutli stanign"
  example="You look absolutely stunning tonight."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="You're the most beautiful person I've ever met"
  translation="Sei la persona pi√π bella che abbia mai incontrato"
  pronunciation="yur dhe moust biutiful person aiv ever met"
  example="Honestly, you're the most beautiful person I've ever met."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Your smile lights up my world"
  translation="Il tuo sorriso illumina il mio mondo"
  pronunciation="yur smail laits ap mai world"
  example="Every time you smile, your smile lights up my world."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I love the way you laugh"
  translation="Amo il modo in cui ridi"
  pronunciation="ai lav dhe wei yu laf"
  example="I love the way you laugh, it's contagious."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="You have the most beautiful eyes"
  translation="Hai gli occhi pi√π belli"
  pronunciation="yu hav dhe moust biutiful ais"
  example="You have the most beautiful eyes I've ever seen."
/>

## Frasi per Momenti Speciali

### Per un Appuntamento

<VocabCard
  word="Would you like to go on a date with me?"
  translation="Ti piacerebbe uscire con me?"
  pronunciation="wud yu laik tu gou on a deit widh mi"
  example="I've been wanting to ask... would you like to go on a date with me?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I had an amazing time tonight"
  translation="Mi sono divertito/a tantissimo stasera"
  pronunciation="ai had an ameizign taim tunait"
  example="I had an amazing time tonight. Let's do it again soon."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I can't wait to see you again"
  translation="Non vedo l'ora di rivederti"
  pronunciation="ai kant weit tu si yu agen"
  example="I can't wait to see you again. When are you free?"
/>

### Per un Anniversario

<VocabCard
  word="Happy anniversary, my love"
  translation="Buon anniversario, amore mio"
  pronunciation="hapi aniversari mai lav"
  example="Happy anniversary, my love! These have been the best years of my life."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Every day with you is a gift"
  translation="Ogni giorno con te √® un regalo"
  pronunciation="evri dei widh yu iz a gift"
  example="Every day with you is a gift I never take for granted."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I'd marry you all over again"
  translation="Ti sposerei di nuovo"
  pronunciation="aid mari yu ol ouver agen"
  example="Looking back at our journey, I'd marry you all over again."
/>

## Frasi per Momenti Difficili

Anche nei momenti difficili, √® importante esprimere supporto:

<VocabCard
  word="I'm here for you"
  translation="Sono qui per te"
  pronunciation="aim hir for yu"
  example="Whatever happens, I'm here for you."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We'll get through this together"
  translation="Ce la faremo insieme"
  pronunciation="wil get thru dhis tughedher"
  example="Don't worry, we'll get through this together."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I believe in you"
  translation="Credo in te"
  pronunciation="ai biliv in yu"
  example="I believe in you. You can do anything you set your mind to."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I'll always be by your side"
  translation="Sar√≤ sempre al tuo fianco"
  pronunciation="ail olweis bi bai yur said"
  example="No matter what, I'll always be by your side."
/>

<CultureTip title="Nota Culturale" flag="üá∫üá∏">
Negli Stati Uniti e nel Regno Unito, esprimere supporto verbale √® molto importante in una relazione. Frasi come "I'm here for you" e "I believe in you" sono usate frequentemente e mostrano un profondo livello di connessione emotiva.
</CultureTip>

## Frasi per la Buonanotte

<VocabCard
  word="Sweet dreams, my love"
  translation="Sogni d'oro, amore mio"
  pronunciation="swit drims mai lav"
  example="Sweet dreams, my love. See you tomorrow."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Goodnight, beautiful"
  translation="Buonanotte, bella/o"
  pronunciation="gudnait biutiful"
  example="Goodnight, beautiful. Sleep tight."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I wish you were here with me"
  translation="Vorrei che fossi qui con me"
  pronunciation="ai wisch yu wer hir widh mi"
  example="I wish you were here with me tonight."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I'll see you in my dreams"
  translation="Ci vedremo nei miei sogni"
  pronunciation="ail si yu in mai drims"
  example="Goodnight, I'll see you in my dreams."
/>

## Dichiarazioni d'Amore Profonde

Per quei momenti in cui vuoi esprimere sentimenti profondi:

<VocabCard
  word="You're my soulmate"
  translation="Sei la mia anima gemella"
  pronunciation="yur mai soulmeit"
  example="I knew from the moment I met you that you're my soulmate."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I want to spend the rest of my life with you"
  translation="Voglio passare il resto della mia vita con te"
  pronunciation="ai wont tu spend dhe rest ov mai laif widh yu"
  example="I want to spend the rest of my life with you. Will you marry me?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="You're my best friend and my lover"
  translation="Sei il mio migliore amico/la mia migliore amica √® il mio amore"
  pronunciation="yur mai best frend and mai laver"
  example="You're my best friend and my lover, all in one perfect person."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I fall in love with you more every day"
  translation="Mi innamoro di te sempre di pi√π ogni giorno"
  pronunciation="ai fol in lav widh yu mor evri dei"
  example="Even after all these years, I fall in love with you more every day."
/>


## Scheda di Riferimento Rapido

| Situazione | Frase | Pronuncia |
|------------|-------|-----------|
| Mattina | Good morning, sunshine | gud morning sansciain |
| Durante il giorno | I'm thinking of you | aim thinkign ov yu |
| Complimento | You look amazing | yu luk ameizign |
| Supporto | I'm here for you | aim hir for yu |
| Sera | I had a wonderful time | ai had a wanderful taim |
| Buonanotte | Sweet dreams, my love | swit drims mai lav |
| Dichiarazione | You're my everything | yur mai evrithing |

## Espressioni Idiomatiche Romantiche

L'inglese ha molte espressioni idiomatiche legate all'amore:

| Espressione | Significato Letterale | Significato Reale |
|-------------|----------------------|-------------------|
| To fall head over heels | Cadere con la testa sui talloni | Innamorarsi perdutamente |
| To have butterflies | Avere farfalle (nello stomaco) | Sentirsi emozionati per amore |
| To be on cloud nine | Essere sulla nuvola nove | Essere al settimo cielo |
| Love at first sight | Amore al primo sguardo | Colpo di fulmine |
| To be the apple of someone's eye | Essere la mela dell'occhio di qualcuno | Essere la persona pi√π amata |

## Consigli per la Pronuncia

L'inglese pu√≤ essere difficile da pronunciare per gli italiani. Ecco alcuni suggerimenti:

1. **La "th"** - Metti la lingua tra i denti per suoni come "the," "with," "together"
2. **La "r"** - Non arrotolare la "r" come in italiano; √® pi√π morbida
3. **Le vocali** - Spesso sono pi√π lunghe e diverse dall'italiano
4. **L'accento** - Spesso cade sulla prima sillaba

<CultureTip title="Consiglio Pratico" flag="üá¨üáß">
Non preoccuparti troppo della pronuncia perfetta! L'importante √® comunicare i tuoi sentimenti. Il tuo partner apprezzer√† lo sforzo che fai per parlare la sua lingua, anche con un accento italiano. Anzi, molte persone trovano l'accento italiano molto affascinante!
</CultureTip>

## Continua il Tuo Viaggio Romantico

Ora che conosci queste frasi romantiche, mettile in pratica! Ricorda che la comunicazione √® la chiave di ogni relazione di successo. Imparare a esprimere i tuoi sentimenti nella lingua del tuo partner √® un regalo prezioso che rafforzer√† il vostro legame.

<CTA
  text="Pronti a padroneggiare l'inglese con il tuo partner? Esercitati con chat vocale AI, salva frasi nel Love Log, e il tuo partner pu√≤ essere il tuo tutor. Perfetto per coppie bilingue!"
  buttonText="Inizia Ora"
/>

articles.title: Expresii pentru √ént√¢lnirea cu Socrii √Æn GermanƒÉ
articles.content:
Germanii apreciazƒÉ punctualitatea, sinceritatea »ôi respectul. Prima impresie conteazƒÉ mult √Æn cultura germanƒÉ.

## Expresii pentru Prima √ént√¢lnire

### SalutƒÉri

<Phrase>
  <Original>Es freut mich sehr, Sie endlich kennenzulernen.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Es froit mih zeer, zi endlih chenen»õulernen.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>MƒÉ bucur foarte mult sƒÉ vƒÉ cunosc √Æn sf√¢r»ôit.</Translation>
  <Context>O salutare formalƒÉ »ôi politicoasƒÉ.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>[Name] hat mir viel von Ihnen erz√§hlt.</Original>
  <Transliteration>[Name] hat mir fil fon inen er»õelt.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>[Numele] mi-a povestit mult despre dumneavoastrƒÉ.</Translation>
  <Context>AratƒÉ cƒÉ partenerul vorbe»ôte frumos despre ei.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Vielen Dank, dass Sie mich eingeladen haben.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Filen danc, das zi mih aingheladen haben.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>VƒÉ mul»õumesc mult cƒÉ m-a»õi invitat.</Translation>
  <Context>ExprimƒÉ recuno»ôtin»õƒÉ.</Context>
</Phrase>

### La MasƒÉ

<Phrase>
  <Original>Das schmeckt wunderbar. Haben Sie das selbst gemacht?</Original>
  <Transliteration>Das »ômect vunderbar. Haben zi das zelbst ghemaht?</Transliteration>
  <Translation>E delicios. L-a»õi fƒÉcut singur/singurƒÉ?</Translation>
  <Context>ComplimenteazƒÉ m√¢ncarea.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>K√∂nnte ich das Rezept bekommen?</Original>
  <Transliteration>K√∏nte ih das re»õept becomen?</Transliteration>
  <Translation>A»ô putea primi re»õeta?</Translation>
  <Context>AratƒÉ apreciere.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Kann ich Ihnen helfen?</Original>
  <Transliteration>Can ih inen helfen?</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Pot sƒÉ vƒÉ ajut?</Translation>
  <Context>OferƒÉ-te sƒÉ aju»õi.</Context>
</Phrase>

### Conversa»õie

<Phrase>
  <Original>Ich w√ºrde gerne mehr √ºber [Name] als Kind erfahren.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Ih vurde gherne mer uber [...] als chind erfaren.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Mi-ar plƒÉcea sƒÉ aflu mai multe despre [...] c√¢nd era copil.</Translation>
  <Context>AratƒÉ interes pentru familie.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Sie haben ein wundersch√∂nes Zuhause.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Zi haben ain vunder»ô√∏nes »õuhauze.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Ave»õi o casƒÉ minunatƒÉ.</Translation>
  <Context>ComplimenteazƒÉ casa.</Context>
</Phrase>

### Despre Rela»õie

<Phrase>
  <Original>Ihr Sohn/Ihre Tochter macht mich sehr gl√ºcklich.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Ir zon/ire tohter maht mih zeer gliklih.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Fiul/fiica dumneavoastrƒÉ mƒÉ face foarte fericit/fericitƒÉ.</Translation>
  <Context>AsigurƒÉ-i cƒÉ partenerul e apreciat.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>[Name] bedeutet mir sehr viel.</Original>
  <Transliteration>[...] bedoitet mir zeer fil.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>[...] √ÆnseamnƒÉ foarte mult pentru mine.</Translation>
  <Context>ExprimƒÉ sentimentele.</Context>
</Phrase>

### La Plecare

<Phrase>
  <Original>Vielen Dank f√ºr den wunderbaren Abend.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Filen danc fur den vunderbaren abend.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>VƒÉ mul»õumesc mult pentru seara minunatƒÉ.</Translation>
  <Context>Mul»õume»ôte pentru ospitalitate.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Ich hoffe, Sie bald wiederzusehen.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Ih hofe, zi bald vidertuzehen.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Sper sƒÉ vƒÉ revƒÉd cur√¢nd.</Translation>
  <Context>AratƒÉ dorin»õa de a men»õine legƒÉtura.</Context>
</Phrase>

## Sfaturi Culturale

**Punctualitatea**: Ajunge»õi exact la ora stabilitƒÉ - nici devreme, nici t√¢rziu.

**Formalitatea**: Folosi»õi "Sie" (forma de polite»õe) p√¢nƒÉ sunte»õi invitat sƒÉ folosi»õi "du".

**Cadouri**: Aduce»õi flori (numƒÉr impar) sau vin de calitate.

## Concluzie

Sinceritatea »ôi respectul vor fi apreciate de familia germanƒÉ a partenerului!

articles.title: D√§nische Begr√º√üungen und Verabschiedungen
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# D√§nische Begr√º√üungen und Verabschiedungen

Die richtige Begr√º√üung ist der Schl√ºssel zu jeder Unterhaltung. Hier lernst du alle d√§nischen Gru√üformeln - von formell bis liebevoll f√ºr deinen Partner.

## Die wichtigste Begr√º√üung

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Hej, skat!"
  translation="Hallo, Schatz!"
  pronunciation="hai, skat"
  context="Die liebevolle Begr√º√üung f√ºr deinen Partner."
/>

## Allgemeine Begr√º√üungen

<VocabCard
  word="Hej"
  translation="Hallo"
  pronunciation="hai"
  example="Hej! Hvordan har du det?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Goddag"
  translation="Guten Tag"
  pronunciation="go-DA"
  example="Goddag! Hyggeligt at m√∏de dig."
/>

| D√§nisch | Deutsch | Situation |
|---------|---------|-----------|
| **Hej** | Hallo | Universal |
| **Hejsa** | Hi | Locker |
| **Goddag** | Guten Tag | Formeller |
| **Dav** | Hi (Kurzform) | Sehr informell |
| **Hall√•j** | Hallo | Locker |

<CultureTip title="Hej ist √ºberall!" flag="üá©üá∞">
"Hej" ist die universelle d√§nische Begr√º√üung - egal ob im Gesch√§ft, auf der Stra√üe oder bei Freunden. Es ist nie falsch, "Hej" zu sagen!
</CultureTip>

## Tageszeit-Begr√º√üungen

<VocabCard
  word="Godmorgen"
  translation="Guten Morgen"
  pronunciation="go-MOR-en"
  example="Godmorgen, skat! Har du sovet godt?"
/>

| D√§nisch | Deutsch | Zeitraum |
|---------|---------|----------|
| **Godmorgen** | Guten Morgen | Bis ca. 10 Uhr |
| **Goddag** | Guten Tag | Tags√ºber |
| **God eftermiddag** | Guten Nachmittag | Nachmittags |
| **Godaften** | Guten Abend | Abends |
| **Godnat** | Gute Nacht | Vor dem Schlafen |

## Liebevolle Begr√º√üungen

<VocabCard
  word="Godmorgen, s√∏de"
  translation="Guten Morgen, S√º√üe/r"
  pronunciation="go-MOR-en, S√ñ-de"
  example="Godmorgen, s√∏de. Kaffe?"
/>

| D√§nisch | Deutsch | Verwendung |
|---------|---------|------------|
| **Hej, skat** | Hallo, Schatz | Partnerlich |
| **Godmorgen, k√¶re** | Guten Morgen, Liebe/r | Z√§rtlich |
| **Hej, elskling** | Hallo, Liebling | Liebevoll |
| **Hejsa, s√∏de** | Hi, S√º√üe/r | Spielerisch |
| **Endelig hjemme!** | Endlich zu Hause! | Nach der Arbeit |

## Nach dem Befinden fragen

<VocabCard
  word="Hvordan har du det?"
  translation="Wie geht es dir?"
  pronunciation="WOR-dan har du de"
  example="Hej! Hvordan har du det i dag?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hvad sker der?"
  translation="Was geht? / Was ist los?"
  pronunciation="wad sk√§r d√§r"
  example="Hej! Hvad sker der?"
/>

| D√§nisch | Deutsch | Formalit√§t |
|---------|---------|------------|
| **Hvordan g√•r det?** | Wie l√§uft's? | Neutral |
| **Hvordan har du det?** | Wie geht es dir? | Standard |
| **Alt godt?** | Alles gut? | Locker |
| **Hvad sker der?** | Was geht? | Sehr locker |
| **G√•r det godt?** | Geht's dir gut? | Besorgt |

### Typische Antworten

| D√§nisch | Deutsch | Situation |
|---------|---------|-----------|
| **Godt, tak** | Gut, danke | Standard |
| **Det g√•r fint** | Es geht gut | Neutral |
| **Rigtig godt!** | Richtig gut! | Enthusiastisch |
| **Bare fint** | Einfach gut | Locker |
| **Tr√¶t** | M√ºde | Ehrlich |
| **Ikke s√• tosset** | Nicht so schlecht | Okay |

<CultureTip title="Ehrliche Antworten" flag="üá©üá∞">
D√§nen geben oft ehrliche Antworten auf "Hvordan har du det?". Wenn jemand sagt "tr√¶t" (m√ºde) oder "det g√•r", ist das keine Klage - sondern ehrliche Kommunikation!
</CultureTip>

## Verabschiedungen

<VocabCard
  word="Hej hej"
  translation="Tsch√ºss"
  pronunciation="hai hai"
  example="Hej hej! Vi ses i morgen."
/>

| D√§nisch | Deutsch | Situation |
|---------|---------|-----------|
| **Hej hej** | Tsch√ºss | Standard |
| **Farvel** | Auf Wiedersehen | Formeller |
| **Vi ses** | Wir sehen uns | Informell |
| **Vi skrives** | Wir schreiben uns | Per Chat |
| **Hav det godt** | Hab's gut | Herzlich |

## Liebevolle Verabschiedungen

<VocabCard
  word="Hav en god dag, skat"
  translation="Hab einen sch√∂nen Tag, Schatz"
  pronunciation="haw en go day, skat"
  example="Jeg g√•r nu. Hav en god dag, skat!"
/>

| D√§nisch | Deutsch | Kontext |
|---------|---------|---------|
| **Kys** | Kuss | Liebevoll |
| **Knus** | Umarmung | Z√§rtlich |
| **Sov godt** | Schlaf gut | Abends |
| **Dr√∏m s√∏dt** | Tr√§um s√º√ü | Romantisch |
| **Jeg elsker dig** | Ich liebe dich | Immer passend |
| **Vi ses snart** | Bis bald | Vorfreude |

## Situationsbezogene Phrasen

### Morgens vor der Arbeit

<VocabCard
  word="Hav en god dag p√• arbejde"
  translation="Hab einen sch√∂nen Tag bei der Arbeit"
  pronunciation="haw en go day po AR-bai-de"
  example="Hej hej, skat! Hav en god dag p√• arbejde!"
/>

### Abends nach Hause kommen

| D√§nisch | Deutsch |
|---------|---------|
| **Hej, jeg er hjemme!** | Hallo, ich bin zu Hause! |
| **Endelig hjemme!** | Endlich zu Hause! |
| **Hvordan var din dag?** | Wie war dein Tag? |

### Vor dem Schlafen

| D√§nisch | Deutsch |
|---------|---------|
| **Godnat, skat** | Gute Nacht, Schatz |
| **Sov godt og dr√∏m s√∏dt** | Schlaf gut und tr√§um s√º√ü |
| **Jeg elsker dig. Godnat.** | Ich liebe dich. Gute Nacht. |
| **Vi ses i morgen** | Bis morgen |

<CultureTip title="Tak for sidst" flag="üá©üá∞">
Eine besondere d√§nische Tradition: Wenn man jemanden wiedertrifft, sagt man "Tak for sidst" (Danke f√ºr das letzte Mal). Das bezieht sich auf das vorherige Treffen und ist sehr h√∂flich!
</CultureTip>

## Besondere Situationen

### Beim ersten Treffen

| D√§nisch | Deutsch |
|---------|---------|
| **Hyggeligt at m√∏de dig** | Freut mich, dich kennenzulernen |
| **Jeg har h√∏rt meget om dig** | Ich habe viel von dir geh√∂rt |
| **Dejligt at hilse p√• dig** | Sch√∂n, dich zu begr√º√üen |

### Nach l√§ngerer Zeit

| D√§nisch | Deutsch |
|---------|---------|
| **S√• l√¶nge siden!** | So lange her! |
| **Dejligt at se dig igen!** | Sch√∂n, dich wiederzusehen! |
| **Jeg har savnet dig** | Ich habe dich vermisst |

## Schnellreferenz

**Begr√º√üung:** Hej! (Hallo!)

**Morgens:** Godmorgen, skat (Guten Morgen, Schatz)

**Fragen:** Hvordan har du det? (Wie geht's?)

**Verabschiedung:** Hej hej! (Tsch√ºss!)

**Liebevoll:** Kys / Knus (Kuss / Umarmung)

**Abends:** Godnat, sov godt (Gute Nacht, schlaf gut)

Mit diesen Phrasen bist du f√ºr jeden Moment des Tages vorbereitet!
